definitions: To fit glass into a window frame or other opening.
To cover food with a glossy, often sweet, coating.
To give a shiny surface to something.
To become glassy or shiny, especially referring to eyes.
examples: The workers will glaze the windows next week.
She decided to glaze the donuts with a sugar syrup.
The potter will glaze the finished ceramic.
His eyes began to glaze over with tears.
